content:
Oxford University have advertised two post-doctoral research fellowships. Both researchers will join a core team working on employment law and algorithmic management as part of a project<https://www.law.ox.ac.uk/research/imanage-rethinking-employment-law-world-algorithmic-management> funded by the European Research Council.

The posts are full time and fixed-term for three years, to commence in the autumn of 2021 or as soon as possible thereafter. The closing date for applications is midday (GMT) on 1 March 2021.

The first researcher will focus on algorithmic bias and
discrimination. https://www.law.ox.ac.uk/content/postdoctoral-research-fellowship-algorithmic-bias-and-discrimination.

The second researcher will focus on data protection at work. https://www.law.ox.ac.uk/content/postdoctoral-research-fellowship-data-protection-work.

iMANAGE - Rethinking Employment Law for a World of Algorithmic Management
